nodes.bodyText:
These should probably stay master I guess? cc @rsynek
The future-8.x branch doesn't exist in the optaplanner repo, only on your fork.
Given our experience this morning, this PR will be tested correctly with this set to master, every time someone adds something on your branch
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,10 +5,10 @@ name: OptaPlanner CI
 on:
   push:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x
   pull_request:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x

nodes.bodyText: Here, yes. On the fork, it must be the future-8.x branch. I wonder if we just can have both of them (master, future-8.x) in the yaml file until this PR is ready to be merged to master.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,10 +5,10 @@ name: OptaPlanner CI
 on:
   push:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x
   pull_request:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x

@@ -5,10 +5,10 @@ name: OptaPlanner CI
 on:
   push:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x
   pull_request:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x

nodes.bodyText:
Actually, we don't necessarily have to: the OS x JDK matrix is available on the small, incremental PRs, while Jenkins PR check and the SonarCloud are available here.
@ge0ffrey I would just leave it as it is and before we merge this PR, we put the master branch back in the yaml file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,10 +5,10 @@ name: OptaPlanner CI
 on:
   push:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x
   pull_request:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x

@@ -5,10 +5,10 @@ name: OptaPlanner CI
 on:
   push:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x
   pull_request:
     branches:
-      - master
+      - future-8.x
